--- Umer Iqbal <umeriqbal81@...> wrote:

> I would like to get some feedback from people who
> have made and worked on SharpNEAT. 
> How does performance (speed and memory) differ
> between C# and C++?
> I want to use C# because I hear it cuts down dev
> time, but would C# slow down my application? 
> If so, then how much? And I am talking about
> NEAT-type high cpu utilization applications, with
> arithmetic and trignometric calculations as well as
> image processing.

I'm also very interested in this question.  The C#
enthusiasts like to claim that there is not much
difference.  I'm of the opinion that there will be a
10-fold slowdown if C# is used in place of C++, for
cpu intensive applications.  But I'm not sure if I'm
correct, and I don't have any evidence to present,
just memories of anecdotes.

=====
Mitchell Timin
